title: Initiative: Project Foundation
description: Set up the development environment, project structure, and foundational tooling for the Feed the Pups game.

title: Epic: Development Environment Setup
description: Install and configure Godot 4, Xcode, and iOS simulator for local development.

title: Install Godot 4 with iOS export templates
description: Download and install Godot 4.x with iOS export templates. Verify installation works.
acceptance_criteria: Godot 4 launches successfully and iOS export template is available in export options.

title: Configure Xcode for iOS development
description: Ensure Xcode is installed with iOS simulator. Configure signing for local development (no paid developer account needed).
acceptance_criteria: Can build and run a blank iOS app on the simulator.

title: Test Godot to iOS simulator pipeline
description: Create a minimal Godot project and successfully export/run it on iOS simulator.
acceptance_criteria: A 'Hello World' Godot scene runs on iOS simulator.

title: Epic: Project Architecture
description: Define and implement the folder structure, coding conventions, and architectural patterns for the game.

title: Define Godot project folder structure
description: Create folder structure for scenes, scripts, assets (sprites, audio), and resources. Document the structure.
acceptance_criteria: Folder structure created with README explaining each directory's purpose.

title: Create GDScript style guide
description: Document coding conventions for GDScript including naming, formatting, and patterns.
acceptance_criteria: Style guide document exists and covers naming conventions, code organization, and common patterns.

title: Epic: ADR Documentation
description: Create Architecture Decision Records for key technical decisions.

title: ADR-001: Game engine selection (Godot 4)
description: Document the decision to use Godot 4, alternatives considered, and rationale.
acceptance_criteria: ADR document created following template with context, decision, and consequences.

title: ADR-002: iOS-only platform decision
description: Document the decision to target iOS only, implications for development, and future cross-platform considerations.
acceptance_criteria: ADR document created explaining iOS-only choice and what would change for Android support.

title: ADR-003: Backend architecture (AWS)
description: Document AWS service choices for photo storage and any backend needs. Include cost analysis.
acceptance_criteria: ADR document with AWS service selection, cost estimates, and alternatives considered.

title: ADR-004: Art asset pipeline
description: Document approach for creating art assets (AI-generated, hand-drawn, purchased, or mixed).
acceptance_criteria: ADR document explaining art asset creation strategy with pros/cons of each approach.

title: ADR-005: Data persistence strategy
description: Document how game progress, unlocks, and settings will be saved (local storage vs cloud).
acceptance_criteria: ADR document explaining save system approach.

title: ADR-006: Photo upload implementation
description: Document approach for the upload-your-dog-photo feature including storage, privacy, and display.
acceptance_criteria: ADR document explaining photo feature implementation.

title: ADR-007: Audio asset creation
description: Document approach for sound effects and music (AI-generated, recorded, library, or mixed).
acceptance_criteria: ADR document explaining audio creation strategy.

title: Initiative: Core Game Engine
description: Build the foundational game systems including state management, input handling, physics, and scoring.

title: Epic: Game State Management
description: Implement the core game state machine handling menus, gameplay, pause, and results screens.

title: Create game state machine
description: Implement state machine with states: MainMenu, ModeSelect, LevelSelect, Playing, Paused, Results.
acceptance_criteria: Can transition between all game states. States properly initialize and cleanup.

title: Implement main menu scene
description: Create main menu with Play button, mode selection (Thrower/Catcher), and settings access.
acceptance_criteria: Main menu displays with working navigation buttons.

title: Implement level select scene
description: Create level selection screen showing 10 levels with lock/unlock states and star ratings.
acceptance_criteria: Level select shows all 10 levels. Locked levels are visually distinct. Star ratings display for completed levels.

title: Implement pause menu
description: Create pause overlay with Resume, Restart, and Quit to Menu options.
acceptance_criteria: Pause button pauses game. Pause menu appears with working options.

title: Implement results screen
description: Create end-of-level results showing score, star rating (1-3 treats), and Next Level / Replay / Menu buttons.
acceptance_criteria: Results screen shows score, stars, and navigation options after level ends.

title: Epic: Touch Input System
description: Implement touch input handling for swipe and tap gestures.

title: Implement swipe detection
description: Create swipe gesture detector that calculates direction and velocity from touch start to touch end.
acceptance_criteria: Swipe gestures are detected with accurate direction (8-way or analog) and velocity.

title: Implement tap detection
description: Create tap detector that distinguishes taps from swipes based on movement threshold and duration.
acceptance_criteria: Taps are reliably detected and distinguished from swipes.

title: Test and tune input feel
description: Playtest input system and adjust thresholds for child-friendly responsiveness.
acceptance_criteria: Input feels responsive and natural. A child can reliably perform swipes and taps.

title: Epic: Physics and Collision
description: Implement physics for treat projectiles and collision detection.

title: Implement treat projectile physics
description: Create treat object with arc trajectory based on throw velocity. Include gravity and air resistance.
acceptance_criteria: Treats follow realistic arc trajectory. Velocity affects distance and height.

title: Implement collision detection
description: Detect collisions between treats and dogs, treats and floor, treats and obstacles.
acceptance_criteria: Collisions are detected accurately. Appropriate events fire for catch, miss, and obstacle hit.

title: Epic: Timer and Scoring System
description: Implement level timer, score tracking, and bonus calculations.

title: Implement level timer
description: Create countdown timer with visual display. Trigger level end when timer reaches zero.
acceptance_criteria: Timer counts down visually. Level ends when timer hits zero.

title: Implement base scoring
description: Track successful catches/throws. Award points per catch.
acceptance_criteria: Score increases on successful catch. Score displays on HUD.

title: Implement streak bonus system
description: Track consecutive catches. Award bonus multiplier starting at 5 catches in a row.
acceptance_criteria: Streak counter displays. Bonus triggers at 5+ consecutive catches with visual feedback.

title: Implement speed bonus system
description: Award bonus for achieving X catches within 10 seconds.
acceptance_criteria: Speed bonus triggers and displays when catch threshold met within time window.

title: Implement star rating calculation
description: Calculate 1-3 treat star rating based on final score vs level thresholds.
acceptance_criteria: Star rating calculated at level end. Thresholds are configurable per level.

title: Initiative: Thrower Mode
description: Implement the game mode where the player throws treats to dogs.

title: Epic: Treat Throwing Mechanics
description: Implement the core throwing mechanic including aiming, trajectory preview, and release.

title: Implement throw aiming
description: Convert swipe gesture into throw direction and power. Show trajectory preview during swipe.
acceptance_criteria: Swipe direction determines throw angle. Swipe length/speed determines power. Optional trajectory preview shows expected path.

title: Implement treat release and flight
description: Release treat on swipe end. Treat follows physics arc to target area.
acceptance_criteria: Treat launches on swipe release. Flight looks natural and satisfying.

title: Implement tap-to-throw alternative
description: Allow tap on a dog to auto-throw a treat toward that dog (easier mode for young children).
acceptance_criteria: Tapping a dog throws a treat toward it. Accuracy has slight randomness for challenge.

title: Epic: Dog Spawning System
description: Implement dogs appearing, being available to catch treats, and exiting.

title: Implement dog spawn positions
description: Define spawn points in each location. Dogs appear at random spawn points.
acceptance_criteria: Dogs spawn at predefined positions appropriate for each location.

title: Implement dog availability window
description: Each dog is catchable for a limited time. Window shrinks as level progresses.
acceptance_criteria: Dogs have visible timer or indicator. Window duration configurable per level/difficulty.

title: Implement dog exit animations
description: Dogs exit via: hiding behind furniture, chasing a squirrel, or running off screen.
acceptance_criteria: At least 3 exit animations implemented. Exit type chosen randomly or based on location.

title: Implement dog catch reaction
description: Dogs react happily when catching a treat (animation, sound).
acceptance_criteria: Catching treat triggers happy animation and sound effect.

title: Epic: Multi-Dog Management
description: Support multiple dogs on screen simultaneously.

title: Implement multi-dog spawning
description: Spawn 1-5 dogs based on level difficulty. Manage spawn timing and positions to avoid overlap.
acceptance_criteria: Multiple dogs can be on screen. No overlapping spawn positions. Count scales with difficulty.

title: Implement dog targeting clarity
description: Ensure it is clear which dog is being targeted when multiple are on screen.
acceptance_criteria: Visual feedback shows which dog will receive the treat. No confusion with overlapping dogs.

title: Epic: Miss Detection and Mouse
description: Handle missed throws and the mouse that steals treats.

title: Implement miss detection
description: Detect when treat hits floor or goes off screen without being caught.
acceptance_criteria: Misses are detected accurately. Miss event fires for scoring/feedback.

title: Implement mouse character
description: Create mouse sprite and animations. Mouse runs out, grabs treat, runs away.
acceptance_criteria: Mouse appears on miss, animates grabbing treat, exits screen.

title: Initiative: Catcher Mode
description: Implement the game mode where the player controls a dog catching treats.

title: Epic: Dog Movement
description: Implement player-controlled dog movement for catching treats.

title: Implement horizontal dog movement
description: Dog moves left/right via swipe. Smooth movement with acceleration/deceleration.
acceptance_criteria: Dog moves smoothly left/right. Movement feels responsive and fun.

title: Implement dog movement boundaries
description: Constrain dog to playable area. Prevent moving off screen.
acceptance_criteria: Dog cannot move past screen edges.

title: Implement dog movement animations
description: Add run/idle animations for the player dog.
acceptance_criteria: Dog animates while moving. Idle animation when stationary.

title: Epic: Treat Falling Mechanics
description: Implement treats falling from above for the dog to catch.

title: Implement treat spawning
description: Treats spawn at top of screen at random horizontal positions.
acceptance_criteria: Treats spawn at varied positions. Spawn rate configurable.

title: Implement treat falling physics
description: Treats fall with gravity. Speed increases with difficulty.
acceptance_criteria: Treats fall naturally. Fall speed scales with level difficulty.

title: Implement treat variety
description: Different treat types fall (basic treat, bonus treat, etc.).
acceptance_criteria: Multiple treat types spawn with different point values.

title: Epic: Catch Detection
description: Detect when the dog successfully catches a treat.

title: Implement catch collision
description: Detect treat colliding with dog catch zone (mouth area).
acceptance_criteria: Catches detected when treat overlaps dog catch hitbox.

title: Implement catch feedback
description: Visual and audio feedback on successful catch.
acceptance_criteria: Catch triggers satisfying visual effect and sound.

title: Implement miss feedback in catcher mode
description: Treat hits floor, mouse steals it (reuse thrower mode mouse).
acceptance_criteria: Missed treats trigger mouse animation.

title: Epic: Multi-Dog Catcher Support (Future)
description: Consider allowing player to control multiple dogs in catcher mode.
notes: Deferred for future consideration. Would need to design control scheme for multiple dogs.

title: Initiative: Content and Progression
description: Implement levels, locations, difficulty scaling, and unlockable content.

title: Epic: Level Progression System
description: Implement the 10-level structure with unlocking and star tracking.

title: Design level configuration format
description: Create data format for level definitions including time, goals, difficulty params, location.
acceptance_criteria: Level config format documented. Sample level created.

title: Implement level loading
description: Load level configuration and initialize gameplay with those parameters.
acceptance_criteria: Levels load from configuration. Parameters affect gameplay.

title: Implement level unlock logic
description: Levels unlock sequentially. Completing level N unlocks level N+1.
acceptance_criteria: Levels unlock on completion. Locked levels cannot be played.

title: Implement star rating persistence
description: Save best star rating per level. Display on level select.
acceptance_criteria: Star ratings persist between sessions. Best rating shown on level select.

title: Create 10 level configurations
description: Design and configure all 10 levels with progressive difficulty.
acceptance_criteria: 10 levels defined with increasing difficulty. Each level is playable and beatable.

title: Epic: Location System
description: Implement multiple game locations/backgrounds.

title: Implement location/background system
description: Support swappable backgrounds per level. Include spawn point definitions per location.
acceptance_criteria: Levels can specify location. Background changes based on location.

title: Create Kitchen location
description: Design and implement kitchen background with appropriate spawn points and hiding spots.
acceptance_criteria: Kitchen location complete with background art and defined interactive areas.

title: Create additional locations
description: Design 2-3 more locations (living room, backyard, park, etc.).
acceptance_criteria: Additional locations complete and integrated.

title: Create Thanksgiving bonus location
description: Design Thanksgiving dinner table scene for bonus round.
acceptance_criteria: Thanksgiving location complete with food falling from table mechanic.

title: Epic: Difficulty Scaling
description: Implement progressive difficulty across levels.

title: Implement dog availability window scaling
description: Dog catch windows decrease as level progresses and across levels.
acceptance_criteria: Windows get shorter within level and across levels. Configurable per level.

title: Implement dog count scaling
description: Number of simultaneous dogs increases with level (1 to 5).
acceptance_criteria: Dog count scales with level difficulty. Configurable per level.

title: Implement treat speed scaling (catcher)
description: Treats fall faster in higher levels.
acceptance_criteria: Fall speed increases with level. Configurable per level.

title: Epic: Unlockables System
description: Implement unlockable treats, toys, hats, and hot dogs.

title: Design unlockables data structure
description: Define data format for unlockable items including type, unlock condition, and assets.
acceptance_criteria: Unlockables format documented. Supports treats, toys, hats, hot dogs.

title: Implement unlock tracking
description: Track which items are unlocked. Persist between sessions.
acceptance_criteria: Unlocks persist. Unlock state queryable.

title: Implement unlock notification
description: Show celebratory notification when new item unlocked.
acceptance_criteria: Unlock triggers celebration UI with item preview.

title: Implement item selection/equip
description: Allow player to select which treat type to throw or hat to wear.
acceptance_criteria: Players can select from unlocked items. Selection reflected in gameplay.

title: Epic: Famous Dogs
description: Implement famous dog unlocks every 3 levels.

title: Research public domain famous dogs
description: Identify 3-4 famous dogs without licensing concerns (Balto, Hachiko, Laika, etc.).
acceptance_criteria: List of 3-4 famous dogs confirmed safe to use with brief descriptions.

title: Create famous dog sprites
description: Design and create sprites for each famous dog character.
acceptance_criteria: Sprites created for all famous dogs matching art style.

title: Implement famous dog unlock triggers
description: Unlock famous dog at levels 3, 6, 9 (and possibly 10 bonus).
acceptance_criteria: Famous dogs unlock at correct levels with celebration.

title: Epic: Thanksgiving Bonus Round
description: Implement special Thanksgiving-themed bonus level.

title: Design Thanksgiving bonus gameplay
description: Define unique mechanics: food falls from table, special food types, bonus scoring.
acceptance_criteria: Bonus round design documented with unique mechanics.

title: Implement Thanksgiving bonus mechanics
description: Build the unique Thanksgiving round gameplay.
acceptance_criteria: Bonus round playable with unique mechanics.

title: Initiative: Art and Audio
description: Create all visual and audio assets for the game.

title: Epic: Art Style and Pipeline
description: Establish visual style guide and asset creation workflow.

title: Create art style guide
description: Define cartoon style, color palette (greens, blues, bright colors), line weights, character proportions.
acceptance_criteria: Style guide document with color palette, example sketches, and guidelines.

title: Set up asset pipeline
description: Define workflow for creating/importing sprites into Godot. Document file formats, sizes, naming conventions.
acceptance_criteria: Asset pipeline documented. Test asset successfully imported.

title: Epic: Dog Sprites
description: Create dog character sprites and animations.

title: Create base dog sprite
description: Design and create the primary dog character sprite with idle pose.
acceptance_criteria: Base dog sprite created matching style guide.

title: Create dog animation frames
description: Create animation frames: idle, run, catch/eat, happy reaction, exit animations.
acceptance_criteria: All core animations created with smooth frame transitions.

title: Create additional dog breed variants
description: Create 3-5 different dog breed sprites for variety.
acceptance_criteria: Multiple dog breeds available, all with required animations.

title: Epic: Item Sprites
description: Create treat, toy, and accessory sprites.

title: Create treat sprites
description: Design various treat types: basic treat, bone, biscuit, etc.
acceptance_criteria: Multiple treat sprites created matching style.

title: Create hot dog sprite
description: Design hot dog treat (unlockable item).
acceptance_criteria: Hot dog sprite created.

title: Create toy sprites
description: Design toy items: ball, squeaky toy, rope, etc.
acceptance_criteria: Toy sprites created.

title: Create hat sprites
description: Design hat accessories for dogs to wear.
acceptance_criteria: Hat sprites created that can overlay on dog sprites.

title: Epic: Background Art
description: Create location backgrounds.

title: Create kitchen background
description: Design kitchen scene with cabinets, counter, table for dogs to hide behind.
acceptance_criteria: Kitchen background complete with layered elements for hiding spots.

title: Create additional location backgrounds
description: Design 2-3 more locations (living room, backyard, etc.).
acceptance_criteria: Additional backgrounds complete.

title: Create Thanksgiving background
description: Design Thanksgiving dinner table scene.
acceptance_criteria: Thanksgiving scene complete with dinner table and falling food areas.

title: Epic: UI Design
description: Create UI elements for menus, HUD, and buttons.

title: Design UI style
description: Define button styles, fonts, panel designs consistent with cartoon art style.
acceptance_criteria: UI style guide with button, panel, and typography examples.

title: Create menu UI assets
description: Create buttons, backgrounds, and decorations for menu screens.
acceptance_criteria: Menu UI assets created and ready for integration.

title: Create HUD elements
description: Design score display, timer, streak counter, pause button for gameplay HUD.
acceptance_criteria: HUD elements created, clear and readable.

title: Create star rating visuals
description: Design 1-3 treat star rating display for level completion.
acceptance_criteria: Star (treat) rating visuals created for 0, 1, 2, 3 stars.

title: Epic: Mouse Character
description: Create the treat-stealing mouse character.

title: Create mouse sprite and animations
description: Design mouse character with run, grab treat, and exit animations.
acceptance_criteria: Mouse sprite with all animations complete.

title: Epic: Sound Effects
description: Create or source sound effects.

title: Create/source dog bark sounds
description: Record or generate various dog bark and happy sounds.
acceptance_criteria: Multiple bark/yip sounds available.

title: Create catch/success sounds
description: Create satisfying sound for successful catches.
acceptance_criteria: Catch sound effect created, feels rewarding.

title: Create miss/fail sounds
description: Create sound for missed throws (treat hitting floor).
acceptance_criteria: Miss sound effect created.

title: Create UI sounds
description: Create button press, level complete, star earned sounds.
acceptance_criteria: UI sounds created for key interactions.

title: Create mouse sounds
description: Create squeaky mouse sounds for treat stealing.
acceptance_criteria: Mouse sound effects created.

title: Epic: Background Music
description: Create or source background music.

title: Create menu music
description: Create cheerful, kid-friendly menu theme.
acceptance_criteria: Menu music created, loops cleanly.

title: Create gameplay music
description: Create upbeat gameplay music that builds excitement.
acceptance_criteria: Gameplay music created, loops cleanly, not annoying on repeat.

title: Initiative: Infrastructure and Polish
description: Backend services, photo upload, iOS build, and final polish.

title: Epic: Photo Upload Feature
description: Implement the upload-your-dog photo avatar feature.

title: Implement photo picker
description: Allow user to select photo from device photo library.
acceptance_criteria: Can select photo from iOS photo library.

title: Implement photo cropping
description: Crop selected photo to circular avatar size.
acceptance_criteria: Photo can be cropped to circle. User can adjust crop area.

title: Implement avatar display
description: Display uploaded photo as circular avatar next to player character.
acceptance_criteria: Avatar displays in game UI at appropriate locations.

title: Implement avatar persistence
description: Save avatar photo locally so it persists between sessions.
acceptance_criteria: Avatar persists after app restart.

title: Epic: AWS Backend (if needed)
description: Set up minimal AWS backend for any cloud features.
notes: May not be needed if all data is local. Evaluate during ADR-003.

title: Evaluate cloud storage need
description: Determine if cloud storage is needed or if local storage suffices.
acceptance_criteria: Decision documented in ADR-003.

title: Set up S3 bucket (if needed)
description: Create S3 bucket for photo storage if cloud storage chosen.
acceptance_criteria: S3 bucket created with appropriate permissions.

title: Epic: iOS Build and Testing
description: Build and test on iOS devices/simulators.

title: Configure iOS export settings
description: Set up Godot iOS export with proper settings, icons, splash screen.
acceptance_criteria: iOS export configured with app icon and launch screen.

title: Test on iOS simulator
description: Verify game runs correctly on iOS simulator.
acceptance_criteria: Game runs on simulator without crashes. Touch input works.

title: Test on physical iOS device
description: Test game on actual iPhone/iPad.
acceptance_criteria: Game runs on physical device. Performance acceptable.

title: Epic: Performance Optimization
description: Optimize game performance for smooth gameplay.

title: Profile game performance
description: Identify any performance bottlenecks.
acceptance_criteria: Performance profiled. Bottlenecks documented if any.

title: Optimize sprite loading
description: Ensure sprites are efficiently loaded and cached.
acceptance_criteria: No frame drops from sprite loading.

title: Target 60fps gameplay
description: Ensure game maintains 60fps on target devices.
acceptance_criteria: Game runs at stable 60fps on iPhone models from last 3 years.

title: Epic: Playtesting
description: Test game with target audience (kids) and iterate.

title: Internal playtesting
description: Play through all levels, note issues and improvement ideas.
acceptance_criteria: All levels played. Issues logged.

title: Test with daughter
description: Have target user (daughter) playtest. Observe pain points and fun moments.
acceptance_criteria: Playtesting session completed. Feedback documented.

title: Iterate based on feedback
description: Address issues and suggestions from playtesting.
acceptance_criteria: Key feedback items addressed.

title: Initiative: iPad Support
description: Extend the game to support iPad devices with appropriate UI scaling and aspect ratio handling.

title: Epic: iPad UI Adaptation
description: Adapt UI layouts for iPad screen sizes and aspect ratios.

title: Analyze iPad aspect ratios
description: Document iPad screen sizes and aspect ratios. Determine how game viewport should adapt.
acceptance_criteria: All current iPad aspect ratios documented. Scaling strategy defined.

title: Implement responsive UI scaling
description: Update UI layouts to scale appropriately on iPad screens without distortion.
acceptance_criteria: UI elements scale correctly on all iPad sizes. No cut-off or overlap.

title: Adjust touch target sizes for iPad
description: Ensure touch targets remain appropriately sized on larger iPad screens.
acceptance_criteria: Touch targets comfortable on iPad. Not too small or too large.

title: Epic: iPad Testing
description: Test game on iPad devices and simulators.

title: Test on iPad simulator
description: Test game on iPad simulator in Xcode.
acceptance_criteria: Game runs correctly on iPad simulator. UI scales properly.

title: Test on physical iPad
description: Test game on actual iPad device if available.
acceptance_criteria: Game runs on physical iPad. Performance acceptable.

title: Initiative: Game Design Validation
description: Validate core fun through early prototyping, child-friendly design patterns, and iterative playtesting. This initiative should be prioritized early to avoid building features that aren't fun.

title: Epic: Core Loop Prototype
description: Build a minimal playable prototype to validate that throwing treats to dogs is fun before investing in full production.

title: Create greybox throw prototype
description: Build minimal throw mechanic with placeholder art (colored rectangles). Swipe to throw a 'treat' toward a 'dog' target area.
acceptance_criteria: Can swipe to throw. Treat arcs toward target. No final art needed - placeholders only.

title: Create greybox dog target
description: Add a simple dog target that can catch or miss the treat. Show basic catch/miss feedback.
acceptance_criteria: Dog target appears. Catches treat if throw is accurate. Simple visual feedback on catch/miss.

title: Create 30-second playtest loop
description: Add simple timer and score counter. Loop restarts automatically for rapid iteration.
acceptance_criteria: 30-second rounds with score display. Auto-restart for continuous playtesting.

title: Validate core fun with playtesting
description: Play prototype repeatedly. Have daughter playtest. Document what feels fun and what doesn't.
acceptance_criteria: At least 5 playtesting sessions completed. Fun/not-fun observations documented. Decision made on whether to proceed or pivot.

title: Epic: First-Time Experience
description: Guide new players (especially young children) through their first game experience with visual hints and encouragement.

title: Design tutorial flow
description: Define step-by-step first-time user experience: what to show, when, and how to detect completion.
acceptance_criteria: Tutorial flow documented with triggers, visuals needed, and exit conditions.

title: Implement animated hand prompt
description: Show animated hand/finger demonstrating swipe gesture on first play.
acceptance_criteria: Animated hand shows swipe motion. Disappears after player performs first successful swipe.

title: Implement target highlighting
description: Highlight the dog to throw at during tutorial. Use arrow or glow effect.
acceptance_criteria: Dog target is visually highlighted during tutorial. Clear indication of where to aim.

title: Implement encouragement feedback
description: Show 'Good job!' or similar positive message on first successful catch.
acceptance_criteria: Positive feedback displays on first catch. Feels encouraging, not patronizing.

title: Implement tutorial skip option
description: Allow experienced players to skip tutorial on replay.
acceptance_criteria: Skip button available. Tutorial state persists so it doesn't replay every session.

title: Create tutorial for Catcher mode
description: Design and implement tutorial for dog movement controls in Catcher mode.
acceptance_criteria: Catcher mode has appropriate tutorial showing movement controls.

title: Epic: Relaxed Mode
description: Provide a stress-free play option without timer pressure for young children who get frustrated by countdowns.

title: Design relaxed mode rules
description: Define how relaxed mode differs: no timer, dogs wait patiently, scoring based on accuracy not speed.
acceptance_criteria: Relaxed mode rules documented. Clear difference from timed mode defined.

title: Implement mode selection UI
description: Add Relaxed/Challenge mode toggle to game settings or level start screen.
acceptance_criteria: Players can choose between Relaxed and Challenge modes. Selection persists.

title: Implement untimed gameplay
description: In Relaxed mode, remove countdown timer. Level ends after feeding X dogs or player chooses to finish.
acceptance_criteria: No timer pressure in Relaxed mode. Clear level completion condition.

title: Implement patient dogs in Relaxed mode
description: Dogs wait indefinitely for treats in Relaxed mode instead of leaving after a timeout.
acceptance_criteria: Dogs don't leave due to timeout in Relaxed mode. They may show anticipation animation but stay put.

title: Implement accuracy-based scoring for Relaxed mode
description: Score based on catch percentage rather than speed. Still earn stars based on accuracy thresholds.
acceptance_criteria: Relaxed mode scores on accuracy. Stars earned at accuracy thresholds.

title: Default to Relaxed mode for new players
description: New players start in Relaxed mode by default. Can switch to Challenge after unlocking or in settings.
acceptance_criteria: First-time players default to Relaxed. Challenge mode available as opt-in.

title: Epic: Game Feel / Juice
description: Add visual and audio polish that makes the game satisfying to play - screen shake, particles, animated feedback.

title: Implement screen shake on catch
description: Add subtle screen shake effect when dog catches treat. Should feel impactful but not disorienting.
acceptance_criteria: Screen shakes briefly on catch. Intensity configurable. Can be disabled in settings.

title: Implement catch particle burst
description: Spawn hearts, stars, or sparkle particles when treat is caught.
acceptance_criteria: Particle burst plays on catch. Particles are colorful and joyful.

title: Implement floating score numbers
description: Show +10 (or point value) floating up from catch location.
acceptance_criteria: Score numbers animate upward from catch point. Larger numbers for bonuses.

title: Implement streak celebration text
description: Show 'GREAT!', 'AMAZING!', 'SUPER!' text for streak milestones.
acceptance_criteria: Celebration text appears at streak thresholds (3, 5, 10). Text is large and animated.

title: Implement treat bounce on miss
description: When treat hits floor, it should bounce once or twice before mouse grabs it.
acceptance_criteria: Treat bounces naturally on floor. Adds physical believability.

title: Implement dog anticipation animation
description: Dogs show excitement/anticipation while waiting (tail wag, bouncing, drooling).
acceptance_criteria: Dogs animate while waiting. Animation conveys eagerness for treats.

title: Implement urgency indicator for dogs
description: In timed mode, show visual indicator when dog is about to leave (thought bubble, patience meter).
acceptance_criteria: Players can see when a dog is getting impatient. Indicator is clear but not stressful.

title: Implement happy dog reaction variety
description: Multiple catch reactions: chomp, flip, spin, bark happily. Randomly selected.
acceptance_criteria: At least 3 different catch reactions. Adds variety and delight.

title: Epic: Child-Friendly Difficulty
description: Adjust difficulty parameters to be more forgiving for young children.

title: Adjust star rating thresholds
description: Change star thresholds from 50/75/90% to more forgiving 40/65/85% of max score.
acceptance_criteria: Star thresholds updated. 1 star is achievable by completing level. 3 stars is challenging but not frustrating.

title: Extend dog availability windows
description: Increase dog wait times: 4.0s start (was 3.0s) down to 2.5s at level 10 (was 1.5s).
acceptance_criteria: Dog windows are longer. Even at hardest level, children have time to aim.

title: Simplify bonus systems for MVP
description: Keep streak bonus only. Remove or hide speed bonus to reduce cognitive load for young players.
acceptance_criteria: Only streak bonus active in MVP. Speed bonus deferred or made invisible (auto-applied without UI).

title: Implement generous catch hitboxes
description: Make catch detection area larger than visual dog mouth. Near-misses should count as catches.
acceptance_criteria: Catch hitbox is forgiving. Close throws feel successful. Avoids frustration from pixel-perfect requirements.

title: Implement trajectory assist
description: Show dotted line trajectory preview while swiping to help children aim.
acceptance_criteria: Trajectory line shows during swipe. Helps predict where treat will go.

title: Epic: Soft Failure Handling
description: Handle low performance gracefully without harsh 'game over' states that frustrate young players.

title: Design soft failure approach
description: Define how game handles poor performance: no game over, always complete level, encourage retry.
acceptance_criteria: Soft failure approach documented. No punishing 'game over' screen.

title: Implement level completion regardless of score
description: All levels complete when time ends, even with zero catches. Show encouraging results.
acceptance_criteria: Level always ends with results screen. No 'fail' state. Zero-star is still a completion.

title: Implement encouraging low-score messaging
description: Show supportive messages for low scores: 'The dogs are still hungry! Try again?' rather than 'You failed'.
acceptance_criteria: Low-score results are encouraging, not discouraging. Motivates replay.

title: Implement progressive unlock even on low scores
description: Unlock next level even with 0-1 stars. Stars are for mastery, not gating.
acceptance_criteria: Completing a level (any score) unlocks the next. No star requirements for progression.

title: Epic: Kid-Friendly Unlocks
description: Replace or supplement famous dogs with unlockables that resonate with young children.

title: Design kid-friendly unlock themes
description: Define unlockable categories that appeal to children: silly costumes, fantasy dogs, size variants.
acceptance_criteria: Unlock themes documented. At least 3 categories defined with 2-3 items each.

title: Create costume dog variants
description: Design dogs in fun costumes: astronaut dog, superhero dog, princess dog, pirate dog.
acceptance_criteria: At least 4 costume variants created. Costumes are visually distinct and fun.

title: Create fantasy dog variants
description: Design fantastical dogs: unicorn dog, dragon dog, rainbow dog.
acceptance_criteria: At least 3 fantasy variants created. Appeal to imagination.

title: Create size variant dogs
description: Design tiny puppy and giant dog variants for variety.
acceptance_criteria: Tiny and giant dog variants created. Gameplay adjusts for size (hitbox, animations).

title: Add fun facts to famous dogs (optional)
description: If keeping famous dogs, add brief fun fact screen so children learn something.
acceptance_criteria: Famous dog unlocks include simple fun fact. Educational but not boring.

title: Epic: Location Narrative
description: Add simple story framing to explain why dogs are in different locations around the world.

title: Design location narrative concept
description: Create simple story: dog is dreaming, traveling, or on vacation. Explains global locations.
acceptance_criteria: Narrative concept documented. Simple enough for 7-year-old to understand.

title: Create location intro cards
description: Brief intro screen when entering new location: 'Dream 3: Paris!' with simple illustration.
acceptance_criteria: Location intros display before first level in each location. Builds anticipation.

title: Group locations thematically
description: Organize levels: Home (Kitchen, Backyard), Dreams/Vacation (Paris, Italy, NYC, etc.).
acceptance_criteria: Level select shows thematic groupings. Progression feels intentional, not random.

title: Epic: Endless/Replay Mode
description: Add replayable game mode for continued engagement after completing all levels.

title: Design endless mode
description: Define endless mode rules: increasing difficulty, no time limit or extending timer, high score tracking.
acceptance_criteria: Endless mode design documented. Clear progression within the mode.

title: Implement endless mode
description: Build endless mode with gradually increasing difficulty and persistent high score.
acceptance_criteria: Endless mode playable. Difficulty ramps up. High score saved.

title: Consider daily challenge (future)
description: Evaluate adding daily challenge level with unique parameters each day.
notes: Deferred to post-launch. Requires date-based seed system.
acceptance_criteria: Decision documented on whether to pursue daily challenges.

title: Epic: Enhanced Catcher Mechanics
description: Make Catcher mode more distinctly dog-like with unique abilities and obstacles.

title: Implement dog jump ability
description: Tap to make dog jump and catch higher treats. Adds vertical gameplay dimension.
acceptance_criteria: Dog can jump on tap. Jump height allows catching treats that would otherwise be missed.

title: Implement bark to scare mouse
description: Double-tap or hold to bark, scaring away the mouse temporarily.
acceptance_criteria: Dog can bark on command. Mouse flees when barked at. Cooldown prevents spam.

title: Design dog breed abilities
description: Different dogs have different strengths: small=fast, big=wide catch area, etc.
acceptance_criteria: Dog breed abilities documented. Each breed feels distinct.

title: Implement dog-relevant obstacles
description: Add obstacles dogs care about: vacuum cleaner, mailman, squirrel that distracts.
acceptance_criteria: At least 2 dog-themed obstacles implemented. Add humor and challenge.
